meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tranquil.
meanings.sent1: The tranquillities of the forest brought a sense of peace to my mind.
meanings.sent2: I find tranquillities in the gentle sound of rain falling on the roof.
meanings.sent3: The tranquillities of the library were disrupted by a loud sneeze.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was a soothing wave of tranquillities in the chaos of the city.
meanings.sent5: The tranquillities of the sunset painted the sky in hues of calm.

meanings.definition: A state of calmness or peacefulness.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, I seek tranquillities in a warm bath.
meanings.sent2: The lake reflected the tranquillities of the surrounding mountains.
meanings.sent3: The tranquillities of the sleeping cat were disturbed by a playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: His eyes held a deep tranquillities that seemed to calm those around him.
meanings.sent5: The tranquillities of the garden enveloped me in a blanket of serenity.

meanings.sent1: The tranquillities of the countryside were a welcome change from the city.
meanings.sent2: She found tranquillities in the laughter of her children playing outside.
meanings.sent3: The tranquillities of the park were disturbed by a sudden gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: The tranquillities of the ocean at sunrise were a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: In the tranquillities of the early morning, the world seemed at peace.
